official-title.#text: To amend the Water Conservation and Utilization Act to authorize the development of non-Federal hydropower and issuance of leases of power privileges at projects constructed pursuant to the authority of the Water Conservation and Utilization Act, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed

action-instruction.#text: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on May 14, 2013

action-desc.#text: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed

short-title.#text: Bureau of Reclamation Conduit Hydropower Development Equity and Jobs Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; commonly known as the

short-title.#text: An Act authorizing construction of water conservation and utilization projects in the Great Plains and arid semiarid areas of the United States

text.#text: by adding at the end the following:

Except as otherwise provided in this section, the Secretary is authorized to enter into leases of power privileges for electric power generation in connection with any project constructed under this Act, and shall have authority in addition to and alternative to any authority in existing laws relating to particular projects, including small conduit hydropower development, consistent with the terms of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , and other Federal reclamation laws.

text.#text: All right, title, and interest to installed power facilities constructed by non-Federal entities pursuant to a lease of power privilege, and direct revenues derived therefrom, shall remain with the lessee unless otherwise required in
Lease of power privilege charges or fees under this section shall be credited to the facility from which those revenues were derived.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall first offer the lease of power privilege to
				an irrigation district or water users association operating the applicable
				transferred conduit, or to the irrigation district or water users association
				receiving water from the applicable reserved conduit. The

shall
				determine a reasonable timeframe for the irrigation district or water users
				association to accept or reject a lease of power privilege offer. If the
				irrigation district or water users association elects not to accept a lease of
				power privilege offer under
, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Bureau of Reclamation Conduit Hydropower Development Equity and Jobs Act/s:2/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall offer the lease
				of power privilege to other parties in accordance with this section.

text.#text:
When carrying out
				this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall apply its categorical exclusion process under the
to small conduit hydropower development under this section, excluding siting of associated transmission facilities on Federal lands.
or the

to purchase or market any of the power produced by the
				facilities covered under this section and none of the costs associated with
				production or delivery of such power shall be assigned to project purposes for
				inclusion in project rates.

text.#text:
Nothing in this
				section shall obligate the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
facilities, as water used for conduit hydropower generation shall
				be deemed incidental to use of water for the original project purposes. Lease
				of power privilege shall be made only when, in the judgment of the

,
				the exercise of the lease will not be incompatible with the purposes of the
				project or division involved and shall not create any unmitigated financial or
				physical impacts to the project or division involved. The

shall
				notify and consult with the irrigation district or legally organized water
				users association operating the transferred conduit in advance of offering the
				lease of power privilege and shall prescribe such terms and conditions
				necessary to adequately protect the planning, design, construction, operation,
				maintenance, and other interests of the United States and the project or
				division involved.

text.#text:
Nothing in this
				section shall alter or impede the delivery and management of water by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for the
				development of conduit hydropower projects or disposition of revenues.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Bureau of
				Reclamation Conduit Hydropower Development Equity and Jobs Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Bureau of Reclamation Conduit Hydropower Development Equity and Jobs Act

text.#text:
Nothing in this section shall alter or
				affect any agreements in effect on the date of the enactment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: tunnel, canal, pipeline, aqueduct, flume, ditch, or similar manmade water conveyance that is operated for the distribution of water for agricultural, municipal, or industrial consumption and not primarily for the generation of electricity.

term.#tail: means any irrigation, water conservation or conservancy, multi-county water conservation or conservancy district, or any separate public entity composed of two or more such districts and jointly exercising powers of its member districts.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , through the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Commissioner of the Bureau of Reclamation

term.#tail: means any conduit that is included in project works the care, operation, and maintenance of which has been reserved by the
means any conduit that is included in project works the care, operation, and maintenance of which has been transferred to a legally organized water users association or irrigation district.
means a facility capable of producing 5 megawatts or less of electric capacity.
